event: Earliest human presence in present-day Ecuador
Valdivia culture develops early pottery and coastal settlements
Regional cultures expand agriculture and long-distance trade
Complex societies flourish along the coast and highlands
Inca Empire incorporates much of the Andean highlands
Spanish conquest of the Inca north and Quito region
Quito is founded as a colonial city
Audiencia of Quito administers the northern Andes
Region becomes part of the Viceroyalty of New Granada
First independence uprising erupts in Quito
Ecuador is incorporated into Gran Colombia
Centralized state consolidates power from Quito
Border conflict with Peru alters national territory
Oil production transforms the national economy
